dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 5141 RH: Maximizing Outcomes through Better Investments in Lifesaving Equipment for (MOBILE) Health Care Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Lee of Nevada (for herself, Mr. Hudson, Mr. Ruiz, and Ms. Herrera Beutler) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

Additional sponsors: Mrs. Trahan, Ms. DeGette, Mr. Butterfield, Mr. Rush, Ms. Schrier, Ms. Matsui, Mr. Amodei, Mr. Tonko, Mr. McKinley, Mr. Peters, Mr. Upton, Mrs. Axne, Mrs. Dingell, Mr. Bacon, Mr. O'Halleran, Mrs. McBath, Ms. Kuster, Miss Rice of New York, Mr. Harder of California, Ms. Tlaib, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, Ms. Wild, Ms. Roybal-Allard, Mr. Welch, Mr. Kilmer, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Sarbanes, Mr. Carbajal, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Lowenthal, Ms. Craig, Mr. Pappas, Ms. Meng, Ms. Schakowsky, Mr. McNerney, Ms. Barragán, Mr. Sires, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. David Scott of Georgia, Ms. Manning, Mr. Soto, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Cuellar, Mr. San Nicolas, Ms. Kelly of Illinois, Mr. Case, Ms. Stevens, Mr. Phillips, Mr. Gottheimer, Miss González-Colón, Mr. Kahele, Ms. Blunt Rochester, Ms. Sewell, Mr. Tony Gonzales of Texas, Mr. Costa, Ms. Bonamici, Mr. Cárdenas, Mr. Johnson of South Dakota, Mr. Cartwright, Ms. McCollum, Mr. McEachin, Mr. Horsford, Ms. Garcia of Texas, Mr. Keating, Ms. Pingree, Mr. Lamb, Ms. Lois Frankel of Florida, Mr. Levin of California, Mr. Veasey, Mr. Huffman, Ms. Velázquez, Mr. Yarmuth, Mr. Takano, Mr. Carter of Louisiana, Ms. Adams, Mr. Price of North Carolina, Ms. Norton, Ms. Dean, Mr. Gallego, Ms. Ross, Mr. Cicilline, Mr. Morelle, Mr. Auchincloss, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Garamendi, Mr. Brown of Maryland, Mr. Meijer, Ms. Bourdeaux, Mr. Aguilar, Mrs. Hinson, Ms. Brownley, Mr. Blumenauer, Ms. Porter, Mr. Joyce of Pennsylvania, Mr. Neguse, Mr. Rice of South Carolina, Ms. Newman, Ms. Strickland, Ms. Wexton, Mr. Sherman, Mr. Ruppersberger, Mrs. Napolitano, Mr. Moulton, Mrs. Beatty, Mr. Brendan F. action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on August 31, 2021

form.official-title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to expand the allowable use criteria for new access points grants for community health centers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Maximizing Outcomes through Better Investments in Lifesaving Equipment for (MOBILE) Health Care Act.

subsection.text: Section 330(e)(6)(A) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 254b(e)(6)(A)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: An existing health center may be awarded funds under clause (i) to establish a new delivery site that is a mobile unit, regardless of whether the applicant additionally proposes to establish a permanent, full-time site. In the case of a health center that is not currently receiving funds under this section, such health center may be awarded funds under clause (i) to establish a new delivery site that is a mobile unit only if such health center uses a portion of such funds to also establish a permanent, full-time site.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect on January 1, 2024.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
